stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the stream working on the main overworld: tweaking the fog/shader system so the scene fades to white as Mario crosses a bridge toward a ship, and prototyping new ‘grape’ bounce objects.  He mentions recent engine breakages, outlines a plan to re-shader every area, and briefly previews other team members’ tasks.

development_findings.summary: Primary task of the session is the “first round of adding shaders” to the overworld, focusing on fog that gradually turns the scene white when Mario reaches the ship.
development_findings.quote: I think we also need to do something with that so that it properly fades into white… I like how everything goes white though as you get to the ship.

development_findings.summary: Modified the fog controller: default near value changed from 970 to 1000; for the bridge section he sets fog to begin around 13 000 units and squares the alpha to bias far values.
development_findings.quote: We still have the issue that there is no fog at all here now… The fog should start around 12 000.  Let’s start the fog around 13 000 and see if this works.

development_findings.summary: Old levels became unplayable after recent engine updates; a dedicated bug-fixing pass is underway to restore them.
development_findings.quote: These old levels are going to become a lot more playable soon because we broke them over time with engine updates.

development_findings.summary: Intends to make repository builds one-button: “execute a script to export every [level] … break the whole repository.”
development_findings.quote: I want to get my repository into a state where I can execute a script to export every… break the whole repository.

development_findings.summary: Experimenting with world presentation: considers removing textures and NPCs entirely and even auto-moving Mario in the big overworld.
development_findings.quote: I was thinking the entire world should just be dead… I think Mario should move automatically so you don’t even have to play the game here.

development_findings.summary: Built a new ‘grape’ actor: individual collision objects that bounce Mario, using shape color × prim + tex0 and a squishy sound.
development_findings.quote: I think shape color multiplied by prim plus text zero is going to look great… I like the grapes. They’re good grapes.

development_findings.summary: Plans to convert remaining engine ‘loops’ into ‘ticks’, eliminating looping audio assets.
development_findings.quote: We’re removing all loops, by the way. Turning all of them into ticks.

context_findings.summary: Kaze holds a day job; weekday streams are limited.
context_findings.quote: Tomorrow I definitely will not be able to stream because I have my job.

context_findings.summary: Shows excitement and satisfaction when fog finally works and grapes compile.
Philosophical stance: sees consciousness as a feeling, not a thing, and dislikes competitive Pokémon math-optimization.
context_findings.quote: I don’t believe in consciousness… it’s a feeling and people confuse it with a thing.

zeina.summary: Zeina is currently modelling ‘Penguin Town’ (Course 13) and will show progress in an upcoming stream.
zeina.quote: She’s currently still working on the Penguin Town for course 13.

key_stories.title: Getting the Bridge Fog Right
key_stories.summary: Kaze struggles to make the overworld fog fade perfectly as Mario walks from the beach to the ship.  Initial parameters leave parts of the stage fog-free; he rewrites the fog controller and repeatedly recompiles until the transition feels natural.
key_stories.challenge: Fog did not appear on the bridge side, breaking visual continuity.
key_stories.process: Adjusted fog near/far values, added conditional fog enabling in the controller, squared alpha for distant bias, tested in-engine.
key_stories.outcome: Smooth white fade now occurs, and Kaze declares the effect ‘kind of cool’.
key_stories.key_quote: Okay, yeah, we got some fog here… I think I like it.

key_stories.title: Inventing the Grape Platform
key_stories.summary: Kaze designs a new bouncing ‘grape’ object for the Casino area, deciding on individual actors, testing collision, colour math and sound.
key_stories.challenge: Needed a whimsical platform that fits the casino fruit motif.
key_stories.process: Sketched mesh in-stream, chose shader formula, added collision and squishy SFX, hot-reloaded into level.
key_stories.outcome: Functional, visually pleasing grapes are committed to the repository.
key_stories.key_quote: I like the grapes.  They’re good grapes.
